{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3015983,"name":"Mathias Petersen","username":"MathiasP","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mathiasp/{size}/241516_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T02:08:21.668Z","cooked":"

We have a limelight 2+ powered with a REV power distribution hub and we are using a network switch designed by @marshall, the limelight works and was recently flashed to the newest version 2022.2.2 in an attempt to try to fix the issue. The limelight will stay powered and will work without the ethernet cable plugged in but the moment the cable is plugged in the limelight switches off and the lights on the ethernet port glow dimly. We have no clue what is going on here, we tested the cable and it works fine the network switch can communicate with all the other devices on our robot, and the robot functions as intended just no limelight.

Ok… what happens if you unplug the power from the limelight but leave the Ethernet? Does anything happen?

Can you also loosen the nuts/bolts holding the limelight just to make sure this isn’t a weird case deformation shorting thing?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":37,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T02:45:33.807Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":79.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":404498,"topic_slug":"limelight-wont-power-with-ethernet-plugged-in","display_username":"marshall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":41985,"username":"MathiasP","name":"Mathias Petersen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mathiasp/{size}/241516_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17672,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team Principal"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-wont-power-with-ethernet-plugged-in/404498/13","custom_user_title":"Team Principal","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016013,"name":"Mathias Petersen","username":"MathiasP","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mathiasp/{size}/241516_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T02:46:57.045Z","cooked":"
Usernam3:

What happens if you unplug the power and try just the Ethernet connection?

marshall:

Ok… what happens if you unplug the power from the limelight but leave the Ethernet? Does anything happen?

Nothing, the limelight doesn’t show any sign of turning on

Have you tried switching the port you plugged it in the switch? You could also try changing the order of Ethernet cables in the switch.

marshall:

Can you also loosen the nuts/bolts holding the limelight just to make sure this isn’t a weird case deformation shorting thing?

As funny (or odd) as it might sound, I’d give this a try. On at least one occasion I’ve seen some odd behavior with tightening & loosening mounting hardware. I haven’t investigated much more than a brief observation so I can’t say for sure that it wasn’t just a coincidence or user error, but it’s worth a shot.
